medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute cholecystitis/cholangitis with choledocholithiasis, presenting with nausea and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until she ate a muffin in the morning, felt mild malaise throughout the day, and experienced acute nausea after a routine cardiology appointment. She vomited multiple times, and this was accompanied by upper abdominal and bilateral scapular pain. Symptoms prompted her presentation to the emergency department. Abdominal pain improved after treatment, but she developed jaundice and rising bilirubin levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, status post coronary artery bypass grafting, aortic valve replacement, hypertension, chronic atrial fibrillation, hypothyroidism, history of bleeding peptic ulcer.
